intro: Fagara stenoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fagara, is a member of the Anacardiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a yellowish or greenish hue. The fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
